name: multinucleated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a cell) having more than one nucleus (= the part of a cell that controls its growth): The presence of multinucleated cells on day 2 of development was compared between the two groups. Only a few cell types in the human body are multi-nucleated. Synonyms
multinuclear
multinucleate
More examplesFewer examplesMuscle fibres are long cylindrical multinucleated cells that originate from the fusion of myoblasts during embryonic development.The vast majority of the zygotes were multinucleated.Pathological studies of patients who died with acute measles found multinucleated giant cells typical of measles virus infection throughout the respiratory and gastrointestinal tracts.
